Client module documentation¶

This is a client-side application for the messenger. Used to send messages to other online clients, store and display message history and contact lists. Uses RSA encryption with 2048-bit keys.

May use the following CLI arguments:

python client.py {server host} {server port} -n {username} -p {password}

Examples:

  • python client.py ip_address port_number

Client will try to connect to the server on ip_address:port_number

  • python client.py ip_address port_number -n test1 -p 123456

Client will try to connect to the server on ip_address:port_number using a username of “test1” and password “123456”

client.py¶

A launcher script of the client app, contains a CLI argument parser and an initialization method for network transport and GUI.

client. arg_parser ()

CLI parameters parser. Returns a tuple of

  • address

  • port (validated)

  • username

  • password for user

add_contact.py¶

class client.add_contact.AddContactDialog(transport, db)¶

Client class representing a window for adding a new contact to the contact list.

list_possible_contacts()¶

Method for filling a list with possible new contacts.

Fills selector field with a difference between a complete user list and added contacts (also excludes current user name).

update_possible_contacts()¶

Method for updating a complete user list from the server.

client_database.py¶

class client.client_database.ClientBase(username)¶

Client database for the messenger.

class Contacts(user)¶

User contacts representation class.

class KnownUsers(user)¶

Client-side list of known users representation class.

class MessageHistory(target, content, outgoing)¶

Client-side message history representation class.

add_contact(contact_name)¶

Method for adding a contact to the client database.

add_known_users(user_list)¶

Method for reinitializing a list of known users.

check_user_is_contact(user)¶

Method for checking whether a user is in contacts list.

check_user_is_known(user)¶

Method for checking whether a user is a known entity.

del_contact(contact_name)¶

Method for removing a contact from the client database.

get_contacts()¶

Method for retrieving a full list of contacts from the client database.

get_known_users()¶

Method for retrieving a full list of known users from the client database.

get_message_history(target_name)¶

Method for retrieving a client-side history for a user.

store_message(target_name, content, outgoing=True)¶

Method for storing a message in a client history database table.

Main client window visual representation class

Method for initializing a client main window elements setup.

del_contact.py¶

class client.del_contact.DelContactDialog(database)¶

Client class representing a window for removing a contact from the contact list.

main_window.py¶

class client.main_window.ClientMainWindow(db, transport, keys)¶

Main client window logic description class.

add_contact(new_contact)¶

Method for adding a new contact to both server and client databases.

add_contact_action(item)¶

Action for selecting a new contact to add via AddContactDialog.

add_contact_window()¶

Method for creating and binding an AddContactDialog instance.

clients_list_update()¶

Method for updating a client list view in UI.

connection_lost()¶

Method for processing an event of losing server connection.

delete_contact(item)¶

Method for selecting a contact to remove via a DelContactDialog and then removing it both for the server and the client.

delete_contact_window()¶

Method for creating a binding a DelContactDialog instance.

disable_input()¶

Method for disabling message input form when no user is selected.

make_connection(transport)¶

Method for binding custom signals to their processors.

message(message)¶

Method for processing a new incoming message signal.

Performs decrypting a message, stores it in the DB and asks user to switch to a new chat in case it’s needed.

select_active_user()¶

Method for selecting a current user from the user list in UI.

send_message()¶

Method for getting message content from UI and sending it to the server.

set_active_user()¶

Method for preparing message input fields for the new selected user.

update_message_list()¶

Method for updating view of a message history for current user.

Get last 20 messages, sorts them by time and adds to the corresponding field as QStandardItems while also applying simple set of styles.

start_dialog.py¶

class client.start_dialog.UserNameDialog¶

Class describing a window which asks for the user name and password.

click()¶

Method for processing a click on the OK button.

transport.py¶

class client.transport.ClientTransport(port, ip_address, db, username, passwd, keys)¶

Primary client-server interaction logic client-side class.

add_contact(contact)¶

Method for informing a server about adding a contact.

connection_init(port, ip)¶

Method for starting a server connection.

Opens socket, connects to the server over network, performs handshake and authorization.

contact_list_update()¶

Method for performing a contact list update.

del_contact(contact)¶

Method for informing a server about contact removal.

form_auth_message(acc_password)¶

Method for forming an authentication request.

form_contacts_request()¶

Method for forming a client contacts request.

form_edit_contact_message(contact_name, op='/add')¶

Method for forming an add/remove contact request.

form_exit_message()¶

Method for forming an exit request.

form_join_message(chat)¶

Method for forming a chat join request.

(unused for now)

form_presence_message(status='Online')¶

Method for forming a client presence message.

form_text_message(destination, content)¶

Method for forming a client-to-client text message.

form_users_request()¶

Method for forming a server users request.

make_key_request(user)¶

Method for performing a public key request

process_server_answer(message)¶

Method for checking a server answer and performing corresponding actions.

run()¶

Main client transport cycle thread method.

Receives incoming messages, passes them to the processing method and watches over the server connection.

send_message(to, content)¶

Method for forming a text message to be sent to a target user.

transport_shutdown()¶

Method for informing a server about a client shutdown.

user_list_update()¶

Method for performing a user list update.
